title: Projects
text:
These are some of the projects I’m working on or have built recently. I prefer to show real things—even if they’re still evolving—rather than pretend everything is perfectly finished. Each project teaches me something new about structure, tooling, and how to make ideas actually run.




Python File Organizer


A practical automation tool that cleans and structures messy folders. It moves files into organised directories based on type and rules, making it easier to keep a machine tidy over time. The focus is on clarity: simple prompts, clear behaviour, and a layout that someone else can understand.


Tech: Python
 Repo: github.com/knhf/file-organizer





This Portfolio Site


A Quarto-based personal site where I document my work, experiments, and projects. I’m using it as a place to practice clean structure, styling, and communication—treating the site itself as a project, not just a static page. Everything from the layout to the CSS is something I’m iterating on.


Tech: Quarto, HTML, CSS, GitHub Pages
 Repo: github.com/knhf/KNHF.github.io





Finance / Quant Experiments


A set of small experiments with financial data, signals, and simple models. The goal isn’t to build a trading system overnight, but to understand how data behaves, what features matter, and how to test ideas in a structured way without overcomplicating things.


Tech: Python, Pandas, basic ML
 Status: Ongoing exploration

title: Contact
text:
If you’d like to talk about projects, ideas, or potential opportunities, the easiest way to reach me is through GitHub or LinkedIn. I’m open to conversations about data science, automation, and practical AI applications, as well as feedback on the things I’m building.


Contact details



GitHub: github.com/knhf


LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/karen-homayounfar-96824893



If you prefer email, you can reach me at:


Email: karan.homayounfar@gmail.com


I’m always interested in thoughtful projects, collaborations, or just exchanging ideas about how to make data and tools more useful in the real world.

title: About Me
text:
I’m Karan, a Data Science master’s student based in Bristol. I like building things that are practical, clear, and actually usable—whether that’s a small automation script or a full project with structure, documentation, and a clean workflow behind it. I care a lot about how a project feels to use, not just how it looks in the code editor.


Most of my work so far has been in Python, R, and SQL, with a focus on data analysis, automation, and turning ideas into working tools. I enjoy taking something messy—files, data, or a vague problem—and turning it into something organised and predictable. I’m also comfortable working with Git, Docker, and Quarto to keep things reproducible and shareable.


How I work


I like to approach projects step by step:



Start with a clear, honest description of the problem.


Break it into small, testable pieces instead of one big jump.


Keep the folder structure and code layout clean from the start.


Document decisions so future me (or someone else) can follow the logic.



I’m not trying to pretend everything is perfect or finished. I’d rather show real work in progress, explain what I’ve learned, and keep improving it over time.


Tools I use



Python – data analysis, automation, small tools and scripts.


R & RStudio – statistical work, exploratory analysis, and reporting.


SQL & MySQL – working with structured data and databases.


Docker – making environments reproducible and easier to run.


Git & GitHub – version control and sharing projects.


Quarto – building this portfolio and technical documents.



Outside of code


Outside of studying and building projects, I enjoy volleyball, exploring Bristol, and constantly tweaking my own setups—whether that’s my home tech, my workflows, or how I organise information. I like finding small improvements that make everyday things smoother.


Connect with me



GitHub: github.com/knhf


LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/karen-homayounfar-96824893
